items.title: Lou Cannon, Post reporter and preeminent Reagan biographer, dies at 92
items.description: His books on Reagan “have never been transcended,” said presidential historian Douglas Brinkley.

items.title: What’s in Epstein files so far? Celebrities, Clinton, few Trump mentions
items.description: The Justice Department has not indicated when more files will be released, and its site no longer contains some files that had already been posted.

items.title: Republican women shrinking their ranks in Congress
items.description: Retirements, resignations and tough elections could cut into their growing numbers from recent elections.

items.title: U.S. strikes dozens of sites in Syria in retaliation for troops’ deaths
items.description: The expansive operation follows the killing last weekend of two U.S. soldiers and their interpreter at a military base in the city of Palmyra.

items.title: Government’s historic role as trusted information source is under threat
items.description: The U.S. government for decades has been the world’s leading provider of reliable data. Many researchers wonder if that is still the case.
